content:
Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste al forum:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)

creator: davidsk

content: Hello The problem lies in how snap packages like Thunderbird manage access to mounted directories. Mounting via fstab integrates with snap confinement, allowing Thunderbird to recognize the folder. In contrast, sshfs mounts may not align with snap's permissions. Stick to fstab for mounting and ensure you run sudo snap connect thunderbird:removable-media to grant the necessary permissions.

content: Filters are separate by account. In windows file explorer, you will see a file named msgfilterrules.dat in each account. Those are all the filters for that one account. You can share with others if all content is the same. The file is a text file and can be browsed with notepad.
creator: davidsk

content:
First, Thunderbird does not administer account space; that is provided by your email host. To increase your allowed space, see if they offer upgrade options. Second, if you are using Gmail, you can save a lot of space by unsubscribing from the AllMail folder. Third, to save space on the account, you could do this:

  1. create a folder in Local Folder
  2. highlight some messages and rightclick and select 'COPY to' the folder. Then, while still highlighted, click delete, to delete from server
  3. OR, you coul create manual filter to copy and then delete.

content: Having email on your PC does not prevent any routine use of the message, such as replying or forwarding. It will remain on your PC until you delete it. My comment on gmail was only if you are using a gmail.com account. Otherwise, just disregard.
